bibl.title: Jeremiah Mangan v. John H. McGraw. Petition Exhibit A
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.p:
Exhibit "A."
United States of America ) TERRITORY OF WASHINGTON ) Skagit County )

To and Constable and keeper of the County Jail aforesaid of said County. Whereas at a Justice Court held at my office in said County for the trial of Jeremiah Mangan for the offence hereinafter stated the said Jeremiah was convicted of having on or about the 20th day of December, 1888, and threatening language to Flora E. Mangan, a dustruct of Guemes Precinct, also that on or about the 2 day of February, 1889, he threatened to burn the house over her head. Also that on or about the 3rd day of February 1889, he thre thretened to murder the gx husband of Flora E. Mangan, and that she should suffer with him, also that on the night of February 4th, 1889, he did with an axe demolish her stove, chimney and cut in the roof over her dining-table, also on or about the 14th day of February 1889, he did threaten to cut the cour corners of the house down where Flora E. Mangan and her children were living also that or on about the 30th day of April 1889 he did throw into the public high-way her farming utensils and tools also that on the 10th day of May, 1889 he did again throw into the public hihg-way her farming utensils and tools all of the above named acts beign commited in Guemes precinct, Skagit County W. T. and upon conviction of having made the aforesaid threats and commited the aforesaid acts the Court did adjudge and determine that the said Jeremiah Mangan should give bond in the sum of Five Hundren Dollars that he would keep the peace towards the all the people of the Territory of Washington and especially towards Flora E. Mangan of Guemes precinct, Skagit County W. T.

for the space of one year from the 18th day of May, 1889, - Whereas the said Jeremiah Mangan has failed to recognize in the aforeasaid amount and says he will give no bond to keep the peaece therefore you the said Constable are cmmanded in the name of of the United States forthwith to convery and deliver the said Jeremiah Mangan x to the said keeper and you the said keeper are hereby commanded to receive the said Jeremiah Mangan into your custody in the said jail and him there safely keep until the expration of one year, or until he shall enter into x recognizance to keep the peace, or until he shall thence by discharged by due course of law. Dated this 18th day of May A. D. 1889 D. L. March Justice of the Peace-

No. 6867
In the District Court of the 3rd Judicial District of Washington Territory, holding terms at Seattle.
In the matter of Jeremiah Mangan for a writ of Habeas Corpus Plaintiff vs. John H. McGraw Defendant
Petition
FILED MAY 27 1889 R M Hopkins Clerk. By H. T. Harmon Deputy Clerk.
Rochester, Lewis & Gilman, Attorneys for
Dearborn, Seattle
